metadata.title: Thursday, 27th February, 2014
metadata.session: THIRD SESSION OF THE ELEVENTH ASSEMBLY

parts: (a)    how many medical personnel country-wide were dismissed for going on an illegal strike in 2013;
(b)    of the dismissed staff, how many were reinstated as of 14th February, 2014; and
(c)    whether the Government is not risking losing qualified personnel, who were trained at a great cost, to other countries where their services may be required.
(a)    how much money the Food Reserve Agency (FRA) owed commercial banks for the purchase of maize during the 2012/2013 marketing season;
(b)    how much, in total, the FRA borrowed from commercial banks; and
(c)    how much interest accrued on the loan at (b) above, as of December, 2013.
(a)    when the construction of livestock breeding centres in all the provinces will be completed; and
(b)    what the estimated cost of the project is.

questions.minister: Minister of Education, Science, Vocational Training and Early Education
parts: (a)    when the construction of Swana Kudya High School will be completed;
(b)    who the contractor is; and
(c)    what the cost of the project is.
(a)    why infrastructure at the Youth Skills Training Centre in Luwingu District has remained in a very poor state of repair; and
(b)    when the Centre will be rehabilitated.
(a)    when Kanyama Livestock Breeding Centre in Mwinilunga District will be officially opened;
(b)    what the planned establishment of the Centre is;
(c)    what the full complement of the infrastructure, in terms of buildings, for the project is; and
(d)    when the benefits of the project are expected to start trickling down to the community.
(a)    who funded the construction of the Mapatizya Mine Police Post;
(b)    what the contract sum for the project was; and
(c)    when the Police Post will be gazetted.

questions.minister: Minister of Local Government and Housing what roles the following committees play in the disbursement of the Constituency Development Fund (CDF)
parts: (a)    the CDF Committee;
(b)    the management staff of a local Council;
(c)    the full Council; and
(d)    the District Development Coordinating Committee.

questions.minister: Minister of Education, Science, Vocational Training and Early Education
parts: (a)    when Mukumbi Basic School in Solwezi West Parliamentary Constituency will be upgraded to a secondary school;
(b)    what has caused the delay in upgrading the School; and
(c)    what the estimated cost of upgrading the School is.

questions.minister: Minister of Local Government and Housing why the Government has allowed commercial stone crushing along Mumbwa Road in places surrounded by residential properties.
parts: (a)    how many human resource practitioners are registered with the Zambia Institute of Human Resources Management (ZIHRM), broken down as follows:
(i)    Zambians; and (ii)    non-Zambians;
(b)    how many practitioners were employed at the following mining companies in the North-Western Province as of November, 2013:
(i)    Kansanshi; (ii)    Lumwana; and (iii)    Kalumbila;
(c)    how many practitioners were stationed at the following:
(i)    Cabinet Office; (ii)    Police and Prisons Service Commission; (iii)    Zambia National Broadcasting Corporation; and (iv)    Anti-Corruption Commission; and
(d)    how many labour officers, country-wide, were registered with the ZIHRM. W19    Mr Mwanza (Solwezi West) - to ask the Minister of Defence:
(a)    how many suppliers were registered with the Ministry as of November, 2013, from the following provinces:
(i)    North-Western; (ii)    Lusaka; (iii)    Muchinga; and (iv)    Northern;
(b)    how many companies, country-wide, were awarded tenders to supply goods and services from September, 2012 to November, 2013; and

(c)    how much money was paid out during the same period. ORDER OF THE DAY 1    The Service Commissions (Amendment) Bill, (N.A.B. 21/2013) – (Second Reading) – Resumption of Debate – (The Minister of Justice).
